intro: Eritrichium rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leafed eritrichium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are rounded and often have a fuzzy texture, while the flowers are small and clustered in racemes. Eritrichium rotundifolium is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
